channel.title: Luring method
channel.description: This guy basically releases lures. The first one was the skull glitch, which actually worked for a while but is now patched. His most recent one is not too good...[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gKfFQxYndBo&feature=channel_video_title[/youtube] Also, this thing has been spreading around like wildfire. Don't be suprised if you get pmed to go to somebody's house.

item.title: Luring method
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:21, topic:413650”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=515182.msg3740992#msg3740992 date=1315346659]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=515182.msg3740448#msg3740448 date=1315284228]

Blakeman said he lures and that it’s an aspect of the game that should be expected. It’s not scamming unless you say there’s a duping glitch in the wildy or something.
[/quote]But that’s exactly what this guy is saying, ‘theres a glitch with my table’…

Well that’s scamming. But a standard wilderness lure, or something that takes advantage of item organization (torag hammer/whip trick) is a smart use of the game.
[/quote]No, that’s called taking advantage of some peoples ignorance at certain parts of the games mechanics.[/quote]
I can kind of see where you’re getting at, in the way that if you get greedy and try to get free items out of cheating, there will be consequences, and it will teach you a lesson. But the skull glitch is just flat-out scamming.

Read full topic

Well that’s scamming. But a standard wilderness lure, or something that takes advantage of item organization (torag hammer/whip trick) is a smart use of the game.
[/quote]No, that’s called taking advantage of some peoples ignorance at certain parts of the games mechanics.[/quote]
it’s ignorant to not know all of the games prices and understand the order determination of drops?

Read full topic

item.title: Luring method
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:5, topic:413650”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=515182.msg3740352#msg3740352 date=1315275496]

enjoy your ban

Actually luring is allowed. You won’t be banned on it from runescape, nor hear. I believe it goes under “meta-gaming”
[/quote]

But it is also considered scamming, which is something not allowed here. But meh, this is a good topic to keep open as a way of learning not to be swallowed by these petty and rather dimwitted strategies.[/quote]

All you can do is get muted for 24hrs for scamming, both password and item scamming, I’ve done it. Worst I got was a mute.

Read full topic

item.title: Luring method
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:14, topic:413650”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=515182.msg3740447#msg3740447 date=1315284159]
Blakeman said he lures and that it’s an aspect of the game that should be expected. It’s not scamming unless you say there’s a duping glitch in the wildy or something.
[/quote]But that’s exactly what this guy is saying, ‘theres a glitch with my table’…[/quote]
Well that’s scamming. But a standard wilderness lure, or something that takes advantage of item organization (torag hammer/whip trick) is a smart use of the game.

Read full topic

i don’t know how ppl lure ppl for the purple portal one and also…how stupid can you be too fall for this.

item.title: Luring method
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:7, topic:413650”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=515182.msg3740360#msg3740360 date=1315275711]

enjoy your ban

Actually luring is allowed. You won’t be banned on it from runescape, nor hear. I believe it goes under “meta-gaming”

But it is also considered scamming, which is something not allowed here. But meh, this is a good topic to keep open as a way of learning not to be swallowed by these petty and rather dimwitted strategies.
[/quote]
like I said, jagex, while not in favor, doesn’t consider it scamming. That’s why these guys say their names in the video.[/quote]

What else do you consider scamming, then? The people involved are tricking other people so the people tricked lose their stuff and the people tricking get them. This is simple theft. A scam is defined as a fraudulent scheme or swindle, which is exactly what they are doing.

As for what Jagex considers scamming, I would not think for a second this is an exception. They are abusing players, of course Jagex doesn’t like that. The only reason it seems like a plausible idea is because it would be very difficult to actually take the measure of figuring out if the person involved was actually scammed. But from my point of view, it’s pretty obvious anytime someone removes an item or items from their inventory, puts them in another player’s house, and then is kicked from it. The guy in the video is rather stupid if he thinks that pattern (which must apply to all instances of POH luring) is undetectable for scamming.

Read full topic

item.title: Luring method
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Davidi2:

educating yourself against these lures isn’t bad at all.

Then the topic should be a list of how to not get lured.
I couldn’t post a DoS tool and say it’s “to help people not get DoSed”, I would post tips such as to turn on Firewall and keep a virus scan active at all times, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Luring method
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Blakeman said he lures and that it’s an aspect of the game that should be expected. It’s not scamming unless you say there’s a duping glitch in the wildy or something. However, placing cash behind a tree at the right angle so tele grab pulls them farther forward so your barrager can finish the job is a whole different idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Luring method
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I think what Taharok is saying is that while yes, this would be against the rules if you were to be caught doing it, educating yourself against these lures isn’t bad at all.

Read full topic
